DataElement.preferredName: Measurable Lesion Or Non-Measurable Lesion Soft Tissue Disorder Computed Tomography And/Or Magnetic Resonance Imaging Detection Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response as to whether the patient had any measurable or non-measurable soft tissue (non-osseous) disease detected on the CT/MRI.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Measurable Lesion Or Non-Measurable Lesion Soft Tissue Disorder Computed Tomography And/Or Magnetic Resonance Imaging Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that a localized pathological lesion can be measured in at least one dimension._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the soft tissue._A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._A neoplasm for which no exact measurement may be obtained. This may be due to a size below detection, an invasive presentation, or pertain to an effusion or ascites.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Measurable Lesion Or Non-Measurable Lesion Soft Tissue Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that a localized pathological lesion can be measured in at least one dimension.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A neoplasm for which no exact measurement may be obtained. This may be due to a size below detection, an invasive presentation, or pertain to an effusion or ascites.:A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the soft tissue.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that a localized pathological lesion can be measured in at least one dimension.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A neoplasm for which no exact measurement may be obtained. This may be due to a size below detection, an invasive presentation, or pertain to an effusion or ascites.
A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the soft tissue.

Property.preferredName: Computed Tomography And/Or Magnetic Resonance Imaging Detection
Property.preferredDefinition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.:The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
